"PROMISING PRACTICES" - FILM 4
PAGE 22
VIDEO
AUDIO
MATCH DISSOLVE TO
76. MS. ANOTHER CLASS.
NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) After
standard section.
77. SAME HIGH SCHOOL HISTORY
TEACHER AT DESK. (HE
PULLS AT TIE OR IS SIT¬
TING AT DESK. )
NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) Can we
wonder that energy. . • ability. . . and impact
fade as the day goes by?
78. NARRATOR ON SCREEN
NARRATOR: (SYNC) Since we put up
those barriers in our minds, we can take
them down. Our shift of viewpoint. . .
our willingness to look with "fresh eyes"
at the entire educational system. . .permit
us now to make better judgments about
how and where our people can function
best.
79. CU. ELEMENTARY MATH
TEACHER. (NEW TEACHER
1)
NARRATOR : (OFF SCREEN) We can. . .
perhaps. . . take this elementary teacher
who is strong in math. . .
80. CU. ELEMENTARY SCIENCE
TEACHER. (NEW TEACHER 2)
NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) This
elementary teacher who is strong in
science.
